net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.binding

Interface UiAccessKeyBinding

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UiAccessKeyBindingImpl

    public interface UiAccessKeyBinding
    This is the interface for a central manager of access keys.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bindAccessKey(char key, UiWidgetActive widget)
      This method registers the given key for the given widget.
      boolean invokeAccessKey(char key)
      This method simulates the effect of pressing the access key programmatically.
      boolean unbindAccessKey(char key, UiWidgetActive widget)
      This method unregisters the given key for the given widget.
      void verifyUniqueAccessKeys()
      This method verifies that there are no conflicts with multiple bindings of the same access key.

    • Method Detail

      • bindAccessKey

        void bindAccessKey(char key,
                   UiWidgetActive widget)
        This method registers the given key for the given widget.
        Parameters:
        key - is the access key.
        widget - is the active widget that has been bound to the access key.

      • unbindAccessKey

        boolean unbindAccessKey(char key,
                        UiWidgetActive widget)
        This method unregisters the given key for the given widget.
        Parameters:
        key - is the access key.
        widget - is the active widget that has been unbound from the access key.
        Returns:
        true if the access key has been unbound successfully, false otherwise (it was not bound before).

      • invokeAccessKey

        boolean invokeAccessKey(char key)
        This method simulates the effect of pressing the access key programmatically. It may be used for native toolkits that do not support access keys as well as for testing.
        Parameters:
        key - is the access key.
        Returns:
        true if the access key has been invoked successfully (as it was bound to a widget currently visible), false otherwise.

      • verifyUniqueAccessKeys

        void verifyUniqueAccessKeys()
        This method verifies that there are no conflicts with multiple bindings of the same access key.
        ATTENTION:
        It is totally legal to create multiple widgets with the same access key. However, there shall never be two widgets visible on the screen at the same time with the same access key. This is what this method verifies for the moment in time when it is called.
